title: Bug 12428: Confusing Message in Pull Up Refactoring
description: The message in the Pull Up refactoring is confusing and has some issues.
OB:
The observed behavior in the Pull Up refactoring includes:
- The message reads: 'copy method 'void setUp()' to type 'TestCase'' (with a lowercase 'c' in 'copy').
- If selecting to delete 'setUp' from 'TestCase,' the message under 'TestCase' reads: 'Delete method 'void setUp()' declared in type 'junit.framework.TestCase'.'
EB:
The expected behavior in the Pull Up refactoring should have a clear and correct message:
- The message should read: 'Copy method 'void setUp()' FROM type 'TestCase'' (with an uppercase 'C' in 'Copy').
- When selecting to delete 'setUp' from 'TestCase,' the message under 'TestCase' should read: 'Delete method 'void setUp()' declared in type 'junit.framework.TestCase'.'
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Perform the Pull Up refactoring on 'TestCase.setUp' (copies the method to 'Assert').
2. Go to the 2nd page of the wizard in the refactoring process.
